newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian House defeats motion to kill MMT ban.
newsitem.headline: Canadian House defeats motion to kill MMT ban.

text.p: The House of Commons on Wednesday defeated a motion which would have effectively killed a proposed ban on the gasoline additive MMT.

By a margin of 124 to 66, Parliament's lower chamber defeated a motion from the opposition Bloc Quebecois to refer a bill to ban the import and inter-provincial trade of MMT back to committee to reconsider the bill "in its entirety."
MMT, methylcyclopentadienyl manganese tricarbonyl, is manufactured by Ethyl Corp and imported by its Canadian subsidiary.

It boosts octane while cutting emissions of carbon monoxide and nitrogen oxide, but environmentalists and car makers advocate using other octane enhancers. Car makers say it could damage onboard diagnostic equipment.

The government bill was first introduced in May 1995 and is now in its final stage, known as "third reading," subject only to motions such as the one defeated on Wednesday. A date for a final vote on the bill itself has not been announced.
